command.name: about
command.description: Displays information about the current project
command.help: Displays information about the current project

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: help
command.description: Displays help for a command
command.help:
The <info>help</info> command displays help for a given command:
<info>bin/console help list</info>
You can also output the help in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:
<info>bin/console help --format=xml list</info>
To display the list of available commands, please use the <info>list</info> command.

option.name: --format
option.description: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: list
command.description: Lists commands
command.help:
The <info>list</info> command lists all commands:
<info>bin/console list</info>
You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:
<info>bin/console list test</info>
You can also output the information in other formats by using the <comment>--format</comment> option:
<info>bin/console list --format=xml</info>
It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):
<info>bin/console list --raw</info>

option.name: --format
option.description: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

command.name: assets:install
command.description: Installs bundles web assets under a public web directory
command.help:
The <info>assets:install</info> command installs bundle assets into a given directory (e.g. the <comment>web</comment> directory).
<info>bin/console assets:install web</info>
A "bundles" directory will be created inside the target directory and the "Resources/public" directory of each bundle will be copied into it.
To create a symlink to each bundle instead of copying its assets, use the <info>--symlink</info> option (will fall back to hard copies when symbolic links aren't possible:
<info>bin/console assets:install web --symlink</info>
To make symlink relative, add the <info>--relative</info> option:
<info>bin/console assets:install web --symlink --relative</info>

option.name: --symlink
option.description: Symlinks the assets instead of copying it

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: cache:clear
command.description: Clears the cache
command.help:
The <info>cache:clear</info> command clears the application cache for a given environment and debug mode:
<info>bin/console cache:clear --env=dev</info> <info>bin/console cache:clear --env=prod --no-debug</info>

option.name: --no-warmup
option.description: Do not warm up the cache

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: cache:pool:clear
command.description: Clears cache pools
command.help:
The <info>cache:pool:clear</info> command clears the given cache pools or cache pool clearers.
bin/console cache:pool:clear <cache pool or clearer 1> [...<cache pool or clearer N>]

argument.name: pools
argument.description: A list of cache pools or cache pool clearers

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: cache:warmup
command.description: Warms up an empty cache
command.help:
The <info>cache:warmup</info> command warms up the cache.
Before running this command, the cache must be empty.
This command does not generate the classes cache (as when executing this command, too many classes that should be part of the cache are already loaded in memory). Use <comment>curl</comment> or any other similar tool to warm up the classes cache if you want.

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: config:dump-reference
command.description: Dumps the default configuration for an extension
command.help:
The <info>config:dump-reference</info> command dumps the default configuration for an extension/bundle.
Either the extension alias or bundle name can be used:
<info>bin/console config:dump-reference framework</info> <info>bin/console config:dump-reference FrameworkBundle</info>
With the <info>--format</info> option specifies the format of the configuration, this is either <comment>yaml</comment> or <comment>xml</comment>. When the option is not provided, <comment>yaml</comment> is used.
<info>bin/console config:dump-reference FrameworkBundle --format=xml</info>
For dumping a specific option, add its path as second argument (only available for the yaml format):
<info>bin/console config:dump-reference framework profiler.matcher</info>

argument.name: name
argument.description: The Bundle name or the extension alias

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: debug:config
command.description: Dumps the current configuration for an extension
command.help:
The <info>debug:config</info> command dumps the current configuration for an extension/bundle.
Either the extension alias or bundle name can be used:
<info>bin/console debug:config framework</info> <info>bin/console debug:config FrameworkBundle</info>
For dumping a specific option, add its path as second argument:
<info>bin/console debug:config framework serializer.enabled</info>

argument.name: name
argument.description: The bundle name or the extension alias

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: debug:container
command.description: Displays current services for an application
command.help:
The <info>debug:container</info> command displays all configured <comment>public</comment> services:
<info>bin/console debug:container</info>
To get specific information about a service, specify its name:
<info>bin/console debug:container validator</info>
To see available types that can be used for autowiring, use the <info>--types</info> flag:
<info>bin/console debug:container --types</info>
By default, private services are hidden. You can display all services by using the <info>--show-private</info> flag:
<info>bin/console debug:container --show-private</info>
Use the --tags option to display tagged <comment>public</comment> services grouped by tag:
<info>bin/console debug:container --tags</info>
Find all services with a specific tag by specifying the tag name with the <info>--tag</info> option:
<info>bin/console debug:container --tag=form.type</info>
Use the <info>--parameters</info> option to display all parameters:
<info>bin/console debug:container --parameters</info>
Display a specific parameter by specifying its name with the <info>--parameter</info> option:
<info>bin/console debug:container --parameter=kernel.debug</info>

option.name: --show-private
option.description: Used to show public *and* private services

option.name: --show-arguments
option.description: Used to show arguments in services

option.name: --tag
option.description: Shows all services with a specific tag

option.name: --tags
option.description: Displays tagged services for an application

option.name: --parameter
option.description: Displays a specific parameter for an application

option.name: --types
option.description: Displays types (classes/interfaces) available in the container

option.name: --format
option.description: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: debug:event-dispatcher
command.description: Displays configured listeners for an application
command.help:
The <info>debug:event-dispatcher</info> command displays all configured listeners:
<info>bin/console debug:event-dispatcher</info>
To get specific listeners for an event, specify its name:
<info>bin/console debug:event-dispatcher kernel.request</info>

option.name: --format
option.description: The output format (txt, xml, json, or md)

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: debug:translation
command.description: Displays translation messages information
command.help:
The <info>debug:translation</info> command helps finding unused or missing translation messages and comparing them with the fallback ones by inspecting the templates and translation files of a given bundle or the app folder.
You can display information about bundle translations in a specific locale:
<info>bin/console debug:translation en AcmeDemoBundle</info>
You can also specify a translation domain for the search:
<info>bin/console debug:translation --domain=messages en AcmeDemoBundle</info>
You can only display missing messages:
<info>bin/console debug:translation --only-missing en AcmeDemoBundle</info>
You can only display unused messages:
<info>bin/console debug:translation --only-unused en AcmeDemoBundle</info>
You can display information about app translations in a specific locale:
<info>bin/console debug:translation en</info>
You can display information about translations in all registered bundles in a specific locale:
<info>bin/console debug:translation --all en</info>

argument.name: bundle
argument.description: The bundle name or directory where to load the messages, defaults to app/Resources folder

option.name: --all
option.description: Load messages from all registered bundles

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: lint:xliff
command.description: Lints a XLIFF file and outputs encountered errors
command.help:
The <info>lint:xliff</info> command lints a XLIFF file and outputs to STDOUT the first encountered syntax error.
You can validates XLIFF contents passed from STDIN:
<info>cat filename | bin/console lint:xliff</info>
You can also validate the syntax of a file:
<info>bin/console lint:xliff filename</info>
Or of a whole directory:
<info>bin/console lint:xliff dirname</info> <info>bin/console lint:xliff dirname --format=json</info>
Or find all files in a bundle:
<info>bin/console lint:xliff @AcmeDemoBundle</info>

argument.name: filename
argument.description: A file or a directory or STDIN

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: lint:yaml
command.description: Lints a file and outputs encountered errors
command.help:
The <info>lint:yaml</info> command lints a YAML file and outputs to STDOUT the first encountered syntax error.
You can validates YAML contents passed from STDIN:
<info>cat filename | bin/console lint:yaml</info>
You can also validate the syntax of a file:
<info>bin/console lint:yaml filename</info>
Or of a whole directory:
<info>bin/console lint:yaml dirname</info> <info>bin/console lint:yaml dirname --format=json</info>
Or find all files in a bundle:
<info>bin/console lint:yaml @AcmeDemoBundle</info>

argument.name: filename
argument.description: A file or a directory or STDIN

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: multi-kernel:create-app
command.description: Create a new app
command.help: Create a new app

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: server:log
command.description: Starts a log server that displays logs in real time
command.help:
<info>server:log</info> starts a log server to display in real time the log messages generated by your application:
<info>bin/console server:log</info>
To get the information as a machine readable format, use the <comment>--filter</> option:
<info>bin/console server:log --filter=port</info>

option.name: --filter
option.description: An expression to filter log. Example: "level > 200 or channel in ['app', 'doctrine']"

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: server:run
command.description: Runs a local web server
command.help:
<info>server:run</info> runs a local web server: By default, the server listens on <comment>127.0.0.1</> address and the port number is automatically selected as the first free port starting from <comment>8000</>:
<info>bin/console server:run</info>
This command blocks the console. If you want to run other commands, stop it by pressing <comment>Control+C</> or use the non-blocking <comment>server:start</> command instead.
Change the default address and port by passing them as an argument:
<info>bin/console server:run 127.0.0.1:8080</info>
Use the <info>--docroot</info> option to change the default docroot directory:
<info>bin/console server:run --docroot=htdocs/</info>
Specify your own router script via the <info>--router</info> option:
<info>bin/console server:run --router=app/config/router.php</info>
See also: http://www.php.net/manual/en/features.commandline.webserver.php

argument.name: addressport
argument.description: The address to listen to (can be address:port, address, or port)

option.name: --docroot
option.description: Document root, usually where your front controllers are stored

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: server:start
command.description: Starts a local web server in the background
command.help:
<info>server:start</info> runs a local web server: By default, the server listens on <comment>127.0.0.1</> address and the port number is automatically selected as the first free port starting from <comment>8000</>:
<info>bin/console server:start</info>
The server is run in the background and you can keep executing other commands. Execute <comment>server:stop</> to stop it.
Change the default address and port by passing them as an argument:
<info>bin/console server:start 127.0.0.1:8080</info>
Use the <info>--docroot</info> option to change the default docroot directory:
<info>bin/console server:start --docroot=htdocs/</info>
Specify your own router script via the <info>--router</info> option:
<info>bin/console server:start --router=app/config/router.php</info>
See also: http://www.php.net/manual/en/features.commandline.webserver.php

argument.name: addressport
argument.description: The address to listen to (can be address:port, address, or port)

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: server:status
command.description: Outputs the status of the local web server for the given address
command.help:
<info>server:status</info> shows the details of the given local web server, such as the address and port where it is listening to:
<info>bin/console server:status</info>
To get the information as a machine readable format, use the <comment>--filter</> option:
<info>bin/console server:status --filter=port</info>
Supported values are <comment>port</>, <comment>host</>, and <comment>address</>.

option.name: --filter
option.description: The value to display (one of port, host, or address)

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: server:stop
command.description: Stops the local web server that was started with the server:start command
command.help:
<info>server:stop</info> stops the local web server:
<info>bin/console server:stop</info>

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question

command.name: translation:update
command.description: Updates the translation file
command.help:
The <info>translation:update</info> command extracts translation strings from templates of a given bundle or the app folder. It can display them or merge the new ones into the translation files.
When new translation strings are found it can automatically add a prefix to the translation message.
Example running against a Bundle (AcmeBundle) <info>bin/console translation:update --dump-messages en AcmeBundle</info> <info>bin/console translation:update --force --prefix="new_" fr AcmeBundle</info>
Example running against app messages (app/Resources folder) <info>bin/console translation:update --dump-messages en</info> <info>bin/console translation:update --force --prefix="new_" fr</info>

argument.name: bundle
argument.description: The bundle name or directory where to load the messages, defaults to app/Resources folder

option.name: --no-prefix
option.description: If set, no prefix is added to the translations

option.name: --dump-messages
option.description: Should the messages be dumped in the console

option.name: --verbose
option.description: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug

option.name: --no-interaction
option.description: Do not ask any interactive question
